name: innocently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 in a way that means you are not guilty of a crime: He said he had obtained the television innocently, not knowing it had been stolen. Is there any way their hands could have been innocently contaminated with the explosive?
in a way that does not involve doing anything wrong, or suggests you are not involved in doing anything wrong: Her relationship with a married colleague started innocently enough. "Have I done something wrong?" she asked innocently.
without any knowledge of unpleasant or evil things in life: The boy had grown up innocently, an only child in an affluent suburban home. They answer questions so innocently, with childlike candour.
in a way that is not intended to harm anyone: I just innocently asked if I could use his computer—I had no idea it would upset him.
